clinical_study.brief_title: Lyrica Dose Response Study With Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, 6-Week Study Of Pregabalin In Subjects With Restless Legs Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: To test the effectiveness and tolerability of Lyrica at various dose levels in RLS patients

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Restless Leg Syndrome (RLS) International Restless Leg Group Symptom Severity Rating Scale (IRLS) Total Score at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: IRLS: Subject-rated instrument to assess RLS symptom severity and impact on daily living; 10 items yielding 2 subscale scores and 1 global (total) score. Subscale scores: symptom severity (6 items) and impact on daily living (3 items), with item 5 (daytime somnolence due to RLS) loaded equally on both subscales. Global score: calculated from all 10 items. Subscale score ranges: symptom severity 0-24, impact of daily living 0-12; global score range: 0-40. Lower scores reflect lower severity and better quality of life. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Responding to Treatment as Assessed by the Clinical Global Impression - Improvement Scale (CGI-I)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement Scale (CGI-I): 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale. Higher score = more affected. Number of subjects responding to treatment at Week 6 with respect to dose level. CGI-I Responders = subjects who reported CGI-I scores of very much improved or much improved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Categorical Scores on the Clinical Global Impression - Severity Scale (CGI-S)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S Scale: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of subject's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): Latency Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Latency subscale (time to fall asleep [in minutes]): numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Lower score reflects greater ease (shorter time) in falling asleep. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Hours of Sleep Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Hours of sleep subscale reflects change in hours of sleep from baseline. Numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Number of Awakenings Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Number of awakenings subscale: numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Fewer awakenings reflect better quality of sleep. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Total Wake Time After Sleep Onset Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Total wake time after sleep onset subscale (in minutes): numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Reduction = improvement. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Quality of Sleep Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Quality of sleep subscale: visual analog scale ranging from 1 (very poor) to 100 (excellent) completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Sleep Disturbance Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep quantity and quality over the past week; comprised of 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Sleep Disturbance Subscale score (4 items): range 0-100; lower score indicates less disturbance. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Snoring Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep quantity and quality over the past week. Comprised of 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Snoring Subscale score (1 item): range 0-100, lower score indicates less snoring. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Awaken Short of Breath or With Headache Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week ; comprised of 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Awaken Short of Breath or with Headache subscale score range: 0-100; lower score indicates less difficulty. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Sleep Adequacy Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Sleep Adequacy Subscale score range: 0-100; higher scores indicates greater sleep adequacy. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Somnolence Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Sleep Somnolence Subscale score range: 0-100; higher score indicates less somnolence. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Sleep Quantity Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Sleep Quantity (1 item) subscale score range: 0-24 hours. Change from Baseline in number of hours slept. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): 6-Item Sleep Problems Index; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Sleep Problems Index I (6 items): composite index score range 0-100; lower score indicates fewer sleep problems. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): 9-Item Sleep Problems Index; Observed Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Composite index scores are sleep problems Index I (6 items) and sleep problems Index II (9 items). 9-Item Sleep Problems Index range: 0-100; lower score indicates fewer sleep problems. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Optimal Sleep; Observed Cases Summarized by Week
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Optimal Sleep subscale is derived from sleep quantity average hours of sleep each night during the past week. Number of subjects with response: YES (Optimal) if sleep quantity was 7 or 8 hours of sleep per night.

secondary_outcome.measure: Restless Leg Syndrome - Quality of Life Scale (RLS-QoL): Change From Baseline to Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: RLS QoL: subject-rated instrument used to assess the impact of RLS on quality of life and health status function (symptom severity, daily activity, social functioning, sleep, concentrating and decision making, traveling, sexual activity, and work) yielding a summary score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect better quality of life. Recall period is the month prior to the assessment. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study Short Form 36 (SF-36): Change From Baseline to Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Subject-rated measure of health status comprised of 36 items: 8 subscale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health), 2 summary scores (physical component and mental component), and a self-evaluated change in health status. Subscale and summary scores range: 0-100. Higher subscale and summary scores = better health status. Recall period: month prior to the assessment. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study Short Form 36 (SF-36); Number of Subjects With Self-Evaluated Change in Health Status Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Subject-rated measure of health status comprised of 36 items: 8 subscale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health), 2 summary scores (physical component and mental component), and a self-evaluated change in health status. Self-evaluated change in health status: 5 Likert-type response categories ranging from "much worse now" to much better now." Recall period: month prior to the assessment.

intervention.description: Placebo control (capsule), once a day, 1- 3 hours before bedtime for 6 weeks
50 mg (capsule) per day, 1 - 3 hours before bedtime for 6 weeks
100 mg (capsule) per day, 1 - 3 hours before bedtime for 6 weeks
150 mg (capsule) per day, 1 - 3 hours before bedtime for 6 weeks
300 mg (capsule) per day, 1 - 3 hours before bedtime for 6 weeks
450 mg (capsule) per day, 1 - 3 hours before bedtime for 6 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate to severe idiopathic RLS
- symptoms occur predominantly in the evening
- symptoms interfere with sleep onset or maintenance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any secondary RLS
- require treatment for daytime RLS symptoms
- symptomatic neuropathies

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects meeting entry criteria with a confirmed diagnosis of Restless Leg Syndrome completed a washout of medications if needed prior to starting a 7-day single-blind placebo run-in to identify and exclude placebo responders and to adapt subjects to take study drug 1-3 hours prior to bedtime. Of 218 subjects screened, 137 subjects entered.

analysis.groups_desc: Dose response analysis ED 50: dose providing 50% of the maximal effect. Statistics were obtained from three parameter model Y = D + G*exp(B*dose) by bootstrapping 2000 data sets, where D = expected response of saturation (maximal effect), B = related to slope of the dose response mechanism (change in response relative to the change in dose), and D+G = expected response at zero dose.
analysis.estimate_desc: Non-convergence for the non-liner model occurred in some bootstrap samples which were not included in summarizing the ED50 distribution or confidence interval.

analysis.groups_desc: Dose response analysis ED 90: dose providing 90% of the maximal effect. Statistics were obtained from three parameter model Y = D + G*exp(B*dose) by bootstrapping 2000 data sets, where D = expected response of saturation (maximal effect), B = related to slope of the dose response mechanism (change in response relative to the change in dose), and D+G = expected response at zero dose.
analysis.estimate_desc: Non-convergence for the non-liner model occurred in some bootstrap samples which were not included in summarizing the ED90 distribution or confidence interval.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 6: Contrast of treatment vs. placebo. The repeated measures model used fixed effects of treatment, geographic region, week and treatment by week interaction. Baseline score was included as a covariate. Additionally, model includes subject as a repeated measurement block within which the covariance structure is assumed to be compound symmetric (CS).

Week 6: Contrast of treatment vs. placebo. The repeated measures model used fixed effects of treatment, geographic region, week and treatment by week interaction. Baseline score was included as a covariate. Additionally, model includes subject as a repeated measurement block within which the covariance structure is assumed to be compound symmetric (CS).

outcome.title: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Hours of Sleep Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Hours of sleep subscale reflects change in hours of sleep from baseline. Numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
outcome.population: ITT; baseline statistics were calculated only for subjects who had a non-missing change from baseline at at least one post-baseline visit.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single daily oral dose.

group.title: Pregabalin 50 mg
group.description: Single daily 50 mg oral dose.

group.title: Pregabalin 100 mg
group.description: Single daily 100 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 50 mg/day after Day 3.

group.title: Pregabalin 150 mg
group.description: Single daily 150 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day after Day 3.

group.title: Pregabalin 300 mg
group.description: Single daily 300 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day (Days 1-3), and 150 mg/day (Days 4-7).

group.title: Pregabalin 450 mg
group.description: Single daily 450 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day (Days 1-3), 150 mg/day (Days 4-7), and 300 mg/day (Days 8-11).

outcome.title: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Number of Awakenings Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Number of awakenings subscale: numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Fewer awakenings reflect better quality of sleep. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
outcome.population: ITT; baseline statistics were calculated only for subjects who had a non-missing change from baseline in at least one post-baseline visit.

outcome.title: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Total Wake Time After Sleep Onset Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Total wake time after sleep onset subscale (in minutes): numerical rating completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Reduction = improvement. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

outcome.title: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire: Quality of Sleep Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Subjective Sleep Questionnaire (SSQ): subject-rated instrument used to assess sleep behavior; measures sleep quantity and quality. Comprised of 5 items yielding 5 subscale scores: latency, hours of sleep, number of awakenings, total wake time after sleep onset, and quality of sleep. Quality of sleep subscale: visual analog scale ranging from 1 (very poor) to 100 (excellent) completed by the subject 30 minutes after waking; recall period is the night before. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 3, Week 4, Week 5, Week 6
outcome.population: ITT; baseline statistics were calculated only for subjects who had non-missing change from baseline at at least one post-baseline visit.

group.description: Single daily oral dose.

group.description: Single daily 300 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day (Days 1-3), and 150 mg/day (Days 4-7).

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Sleep Disturbance Subscale; Observed Change From Baseline
outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep quantity and quality over the past week; comprised of 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Sleep Disturbance Subscale score (4 items): range 0-100; lower score indicates less disturbance. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: ITT, Baseline statistics were calculated only for subjects who had non-missing change from baseline at at least one post-baseline visit.

Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study - Sleep Scale (MOSS-SS): Optimal Sleep; Observed Cases Summarized by Week
outcome.description: MOS-SS: subject-rated instrument used to assess the key constructs of sleep over the past week; assesses sleep quantity and quality and is comprised 12 items yielding 7 subscale scores and 2 composite index scores. Optimal Sleep subscale is derived from sleep quantity average hours of sleep each night during the past week. Number of subjects with response: YES (Optimal) if sleep quantity was 7 or 8 hours of sleep per night.
outcome.population: ITT

outcome.title: Restless Leg Syndrome - Quality of Life Scale (RLS-QoL): Change From Baseline to Week 6
outcome.description: RLS QoL: subject-rated instrument used to assess the impact of RLS on quality of life and health status function (symptom severity, daily activity, social functioning, sleep, concentrating and decision making, traveling, sexual activity, and work) yielding a summary score ranging from 0-100. Higher scores reflect better quality of life. Recall period is the month prior to the assessment. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: ITT; N = Subjects who were randomized and received at least one dose of study drug; baseline n = subjects who were randomized and received at least one dose of study drug, and had baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study Short Form 36 (SF-36): Change From Baseline to Week 6
outcome.description: Subject-rated measure of health status comprised of 36 items: 8 subscale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health), 2 summary scores (physical component and mental component), and a self-evaluated change in health status. Subscale and summary scores range: 0-100. Higher subscale and summary scores = better health status. Recall period: month prior to the assessment. Change from baseline = score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: ITT; N = Subjects who were randomized and received at least one dose of study drug; baseline n = subjects who were randomized and received at least one dose of study drug, had baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study Short Form 36 (SF-36); Number of Subjects With Self-Evaluated Change in Health Status Scores
outcome.description: Subject-rated measure of health status comprised of 36 items: 8 subscale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health), 2 summary scores (physical component and mental component), and a self-evaluated change in health status. Self-evaluated change in health status: 5 Likert-type response categories ranging from "much worse now" to much better now." Recall period: month prior to the assessment.
outcome.population: ITT; N = number of subjects in a treatment group.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single daily oral dose.

group.title: Pregabalin 50 mg
group.description: Single daily 50 mg oral dose.

group.title: Pregabalin 100 mg
group.description: Single daily 100 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 50 mg/day after Day 3.

group.title: Pregabalin 150 mg
group.description: Single daily 150 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day after Day 3.

group.title: Pregabalin 300 mg
group.description: Single daily 300 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day (Days 1-3), and 150 mg/day (Days 4-7).

group.title: Pregabalin 450 mg
group.description: Single daily 450 mg oral dose. Dose was escalated from 75 mg/day (Days 1-3), 150 mg/day (Days 4-7), and 300 mg/day (Days 8-11).

measure.title: Medical Outcomes Study Short Form 36 (SF-36); Number of Subjects With Self-Evaluated Change in Health Status Scores
measure.description: Subject-rated measure of health status comprised of 36 items: 8 subscale scores (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health), 2 summary scores (physical component and mental component), and a self-evaluated change in health status. Self-evaluated change in health status: 5 Likert-type response categories ranging from "much worse now" to much better now." Recall period: month prior to the assessment.
measure.population: ITT; N = number of subjects in a treatment group.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
